TopicTitle: Forum up again. KSP progress down again.

Articles.Content:
Well, it seems that when the forum is down. My progress in KSP goes up. And when the forum is up. I spend most time reading the forum, looking for 'something' sometimes, it give an 'ah this is it' but most of the time, I'll just like browsing briefly answering some general question, admired on work of others...and I feel lost of interest in KSP gaming environment.

I guess I need to surf less...play more. Wish all happy gaming!
Have you considered looking into NAV-COM. Its a forum game where people with companies can wage battles against other companies.

@war Eagle 1

I'm not interested in war. Killing each other is no fun.
That's my problem too. I spend a long time browsing the forums, coming up with brilliant ideas. Then when I sit down to try and create them, I can't figure it out, rage quit, and repeat.

Maybe someone should make a 'web browser' mod for KSP so that you can browse the KSP forum over a virtualized comms terminal while in-game.

Of questionable usefulness, but rather amusing idea.

Maybe someone should make a 'web browser' mod for KSP so that you can browse the KSP forum over a virtualized comms terminal while in-game.

Of questionable usefulness, but rather amusing idea.

Or a mod to access IRC networks while in flight, without having to constantly minimize the KSP window to chat and/or check if anyone's said something
